oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Potenzial entomopathogener Pilze zur Kontrolle des Rapsglanzkäfers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kuske, Stefan
Pilz, Christina
Kölliker, Ursula
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fungal isolates of Beauveria bassiana (21 isolates), B. brongniartii (2), Paecilomyces fumosoroseus (1) and Metarhizium anisopliae (1) were screened for virulence against pollen beetle Meligethes aeneus. Most of the tested B. bassiana isolates originated from naturally infected pollen beetles collected in Switzerland. In a lab bioassay adult beetles were dipped into a defined conidial suspension and fungal infection was recorded after 15 days. Seven isolates of B. bassiana as well as the P. fumosoroseus F4K caused infection rates between 67.9% and 80% respectively and proved to be promising strains for potential use against pollen beetles. However, more experiments are needed to confirm their biological control potential under field conditions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kuske, Stefan; Pilz, Christina and Kölliker, Ursula (2009) Potenzial entomopathogener Pilze zur Kontrolle des Rapsglanzkäfers. Poster at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
